p:
Previous literature in multiple species provides evidence that beta signals in the sensorimotor cortex may contain information about the timing and kinematics of voluntary movements
19, 44, 45 , although this is not always the case
46 . To determine whether such interactions were present in pre-movement beta signals, we correlated the trial-by-trial beta data to the measured reaction time and reach duration of the upcoming reach. In both species, we found a significant non-parametric correlation between pre-movement beta power and both metrics (Human: ρ ReactionTime = 0.053, p = 0.002, ρ ReachDuration = − 0.103, p < 0.0005; cat: ρ ReactionTime = − 0.76, p = 0.002, ρ ReachDuration = − 0.537, p < 0.0005).
